_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
WESTERN PLAINS ENERGY, LLC

Western Plains Energy, LLC is a newly constructed facility.  Many of the reports and information have only recently been developed.  Given that Western Plains Energy, LLC is a new facility, there has been constant review and revisions to reports and information prior to the start up of the facility.  On the same note, there has never been a change in management.  The management is "new" and therefore, the "new" management was implemented with the construction of the facility.  

Accidental Release Prevention and Response Policies:

Western Plains Energy, LLC has a commitment to worker and public safety.  This commitment is demonstrated in the resources invested in accident prevention, such as training personnel as well as considering safety in the design, installation, operation, and maintenance of the facility.

Western Plains Energy, LLC's policy is to implement reasonable controls to prevent foreseeable releases of regulated substances.  However, if a release does occur, plant personnel will respond to control the release as necessary.

Description of the Stationary Source and Regulated Substance:

Western Plains Energy, LLC ethanol plant is located near Oakley, Gove County, Kansas.

The facility operates 24 hours per day, 7 days per week for the purpose of manufacturing fuel grade ethanol from corn.  The regulated substance under the RMP program is Natural Gasoline, also known as Denaturant.  Western Plains Energy, LLC has determined that the radius of impact from a worst-case release would be about 0.6 miles; due to the amount of denaturant stored on site.

Off-site Consequences Analysis Results:

The worst-case scenario at the facility is the release of 560,000 pounds of denaturant creating a vapor cloud fire.  The worst-case scenario is based on a release from entire denaturant tank.  The worst case vapor cloud endpoint is approximately 0.6 miles from the center of the facility.  There are rur

al residence homes within the 0.6 mile radius.

Although Western Plains Energy, LLC has numerous controls in place to prevent such a release and to manage potential consequences, no credit for administrative controls or passive mitigation measures were taken into account in evaluating this scenario.  Alternative scenarios have also been determined for this process. 

Since the facility qualifies as a Program 3, Process Safety Management has to be completed for this facility.

Five Year Accident History:

Western Plains Energy, LLC has constructed a new ethanol facility and is subject to RMP upon delivery of denaturant.  Therefore, no releases or accidents have occurred at this facility.

Emergency Response Program Information:

Western Plains Energy, LLC ethanol plant has several safety programs in place at the facility that incorporate emergency response, including a Health and Safety Plan.  An SPCC will be prepared and implemented in accordance with the applicable regulatory standards and timeframes.

The facility also conducts employee training as part of the facility activities.  Western Plains Energy, LLC's corporate policy places the utmost importance on worker, public and environmental safety, which is reflected in facility plans and training activities.

A safety inspection and review of the facility's emergency response plan is pending.
